entry.content:
Call this a self-effacing journal entry.
My phone recently suffered some minor water damage, and I was easily able to get a replacement for $100. Thank you insurance, you did your part, will be removing you now. I'd be kinda happy to have a new device with zero miles on it, except...
My previous phone was a Oneplus 7 Pro, the dumb orange one with the 5g. I got it for half off on a desperation promo, I loved it to death, with it's pop-up camera and notification slider, and the fact that no one has heard of the thing.
The insurance guys sent me a Note 10 Plus. Apparently they were out of that model. Because there weren't that many. Because no one had heard of it.
It says a lot about my character that I experience so much internal strife at the prospect of having to, however briefly, use a Normie Phone. I could turn around and sell it for $300 tops, and use that money to buy...nothing that excites me, at the moment. Some overpriced Sony midranger? The Nothing Phone? Eh. Nokia hasn't made anything good,
I used to sell phones. I have strong opinions about them (I have legit sherlock-scanned people based on their phones). It's a personal accessory, it doesn't say nothing about it's owner. I made a lot of money matching up the Note series with the right people; I got so many grumpy boomers to upgrade to the things. They're good devices, the pen is nice for the tactical games I play, I like scrolling around with it. This thing will last me two more years easily. I really do care less and less about phone crap; I hate the world they've created, and feel somehow implicated. Twitter is on phones man, and I knew that, and I was selling the things anyways.
And I'm still pissy that someone might see the phone I have and mistake me for a Normie.
Urge to buy Xperia 10 IV, rising. It's got a side-mounted fingerprint scanner, and a really long aspect ratio. Visually striking, and people do recognize Sony, so Sony making phones will blow their mind. There's a green one...
Yes, I choose the phone I use based on the opportunities it gives me to indicate to people that I am different, in whatever small, inconsequential way. I once used the Razer phone, the monolith with the RGB shit on the back. Before that, the Moto Z, the phone with magnetic modular doodads. Before that, the Essential phone, a titanium brick from 2016 that looked exactly like the latest iphones somehow.
I have a disorder: >!I can't like popular things!<
